channel.title: Drunkbunny's new and improved sketchbook
channel.description:
i noticed theres a graphics section now so i decided to post my new and improved sketchbook here.. most of it is game of thrones fan art :P
you'll notice my signature go from "bw" to "aw" (or that i completely forgot to sign them), thats cause i changed my name haha
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc6/181065_116378875168583_1827864930_n.jpg[/img]
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/295095_116375095168961_207512323_n.jpg[/img]
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/255555_119679991505138_462896905_n.jpg[/img]
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/421482_116379468501857_612974868_n.jpg[/img]
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/544762_116375588502245_1469308906_n.jpg[/img]
[img]http://a8.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/457149_121296208010183_1765427498_o.jpg[/img] -- starting my portrait study, prepare for lots of them.
[img]http://a2.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc7/459056_121590261314111_180293513_o.jpg[/img]
[img]http://a1.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/169681_128227880650349_707497347_o.jpg[/img]
theres a ton more portraits between the time those were made and the time these ones below were made.. but i mostly decided to not upload them/delete them since it was more of just a study than actually making fanart.
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-snc6/179149_130810380392099_1431801157_n.jpg[/img]
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/524034_130817077058096_683977191_n.jpg[/img]
actually just made these above two tonight, and i'll probably be making more. enjoy.
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/599285_130980073708463_371520745_n.jpg[/img] early morning art, whee.
[img]http://sphotos.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/582012_131186763687794_89257651_n.jpg[/img] just made this one, viserys feels.. ;_;

Season 3 needs to air already so I can start making fanart of the new characters… I’m gonna make so much Meera and Jojen art… oh my.

Here’s some more GoT fanart I forgot to post. These are pretty old, I just forgot to post them for whatever reason. (derp)

aaand some stuffs i made last night

Your art is amazing, you should be proud of it :D[/quote]

my ego can now fit through doors again
and thank you <3

probably the best thing i’ve painted


expect more metal-y things

on a sidenote, I use Photoshop Elements 10 and a Genius MousePen M508 to do all this, I got asked about it so
Thanks for all the compliments and feedback guise <3
now someone insult me before my ego gets too big

item.title: Drunkbunny's new and improved sketchbook
item.dc:creator: @TheDrunkBunny TheDrunkBunny
item.description:
@TheDrunkBunny wrote:

guise <3

anyways havent updated in a while, made more things

tumblr_m7yrejXEIK1r7p6yto1_500.jpg500×667

I tried to do a light study on Sansa… lol

… aaaaand again on jon. not sure how i feel about these.

i tried using a square brush instead of the normal circle brush…

…feels. i spent all night on the face and then i got to the hair and was just like “ahhh fuck it” lol
edit: is it just me or does ned’s face seem more blue than the rest? I messed with the temperature when I was finished and made it warmer, but the face remained mostly unchanged… maybe im just trippin.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:19, topic:448609”]GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES GAME OF THRONES

That got my really excited. These are really good. YAYAYAYAYAY[/quote]

Lol’d.

OT: wow, these are pretty amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunkbunny's new and improved sketchbook
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“TheDrunkBunny, post:33, topic:448609”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=551508.msg4062818#msg4062818 date=1343584208]

Damn, I didn’t actually think anyone else watched GoT… Did you finish the second season?

I’ve watched it probably a thousand times. Seen both seasons and on the third book.

I’m on the second book right now, I like watching them and then reading them, because the show does it so well that I can picture each and every scene right in my head and I can pronounce everything right… I know some say that takes the fun away because you like to see what you see and pronounce the way you like it but he did it so well I wouldn’t want anything changed.

I’ve got a friend who would only read parts of the book after he watched the episode, but what with season 3 being aired in an ungodly 246 days, most of the people who do that will probably want to go ahead and read the rest of the book(s).

I just want to finish the series and then re read it one POV at a time… seems pretty cool.

I did that with the first book, I’d watch an episode then read up the the part where the episode ended, it worked but then I was just like FUCK IT I NEED TO WATCH THEM ALL! because I had little to no time to read compared to watching the show.
Yeah, I’ll probably finish the second book and start a little on the first.

When I first watched Game of Thrones I had already read the first book and didn’t even know it was a show x) I watched the entire first season in one night and then started watching the second season regularly. As far as the third book and will be third season, U’d definitely read the book first. It’s such an emotional rollercoaster that I’m glad I know whats going to happen, even though seeing it on screen is gonna give me tremendous feels ;_;

despite the emotional effects, GRRM is a brilliant author. ASOIAF/GoT is the best thing I’ve read and watched since LOTR

Agree completely, and the ending of the second season (from what I watched) made me yell that I have to wait another 200+ days! OMG >_>
[/quote]
yeah joffrey is a total dick in every single episode he’s in. Sansa’s walking away and then smiling was priceless though… and I like Margaery, she was good to Renly and I think she’ll make a more than decent queen. I love how the whole “I want to be THE queen” line from Renly’s death/funeral connected with the story. 10/good for GRRM.

Still not fair we have to wait till march 31st to watch season 3 ;_; I was expecting it in the fall…[/quote]
I didn’t even know they confirmed it until I looked it up.
The last episode was amazing, it tied everything up so perfectly but then again left so much hanging.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunkbunny's new and improved sketchbook
item.dc:creator: @TheDrunkBunny TheDrunkBunny
item.description:
@TheDrunkBunny wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:32, topic:448609”][quote author=TheDrunkBunny link=topic=551508.msg4062796#msg4062796 date=1343580855]

Damn, I didn’t actually think anyone else watched GoT… Did you finish the second season?

I’ve watched it probably a thousand times. Seen both seasons and on the third book.

I’m on the second book right now, I like watching them and then reading them, because the show does it so well that I can picture each and every scene right in my head and I can pronounce everything right… I know some say that takes the fun away because you like to see what you see and pronounce the way you like it but he did it so well I wouldn’t want anything changed.

I’ve got a friend who would only read parts of the book after he watched the episode, but what with season 3 being aired in an ungodly 246 days, most of the people who do that will probably want to go ahead and read the rest of the book(s).

I just want to finish the series and then re read it one POV at a time… seems pretty cool.

I did that with the first book, I’d watch an episode then read up the the part where the episode ended, it worked but then I was just like FUCK IT I NEED TO WATCH THEM ALL! because I had little to no time to read compared to watching the show.
Yeah, I’ll probably finish the second book and start a little on the first.

When I first watched Game of Thrones I had already read the first book and didn’t even know it was a show x) I watched the entire first season in one night and then started watching the second season regularly. As far as the third book and will be third season, U’d definitely read the book first. It’s such an emotional rollercoaster that I’m glad I know whats going to happen, even though seeing it on screen is gonna give me tremendous feels ;_;

despite the emotional effects, GRRM is a brilliant author. ASOIAF/GoT is the best thing I’ve read and watched since LOTR
[/quote]
Agree completely, and the ending of the second season (from what I watched) made me yell that I have to wait another 200+ days! OMG >_>[/quote]
yeah joffrey is a total dick in every single episode he’s in. Sansa’s walking away and then smiling was priceless though… and I like Margaery, she was good to Renly and I think she’ll make a more than decent queen. I love how the whole “I want to be THE queen” line from Renly’s death/funeral connected with the story. 10/good for GRRM.

Still not fair we have to wait till march 31st to watch season 3 ;_; I was expecting it in the fall…

Read full topic

Damn, I didn’t actually think anyone else watched GoT… Did you finish the second season?

I’ve watched it probably a thousand times. Seen both seasons and on the third book.

I’m on the second book right now, I like watching them and then reading them, because the show does it so well that I can picture each and every scene right in my head and I can pronounce everything right… I know some say that takes the fun away because you like to see what you see and pronounce the way you like it but he did it so well I wouldn’t want anything changed.

I’ve got a friend who would only read parts of the book after he watched the episode, but what with season 3 being aired in an ungodly 246 days, most of the people who do that will probably want to go ahead and read the rest of the book(s).

I just want to finish the series and then re read it one POV at a time… seems pretty cool.

I did that with the first book, I’d watch an episode then read up the the part where the episode ended, it worked but then I was just like FUCK IT I NEED TO WATCH THEM ALL! because I had little to no time to read compared to watching the show.
Yeah, I’ll probably finish the second book and start a little on the first.
[/quote]
When I first watched Game of Thrones I had already read the first book and didn’t even know it was a show x) I watched the entire first season in one night and then started watching the second season regularly. As far as the third book and will be third season, U’d definitely read the book first. It’s such an emotional rollercoaster that I’m glad I know whats going to happen, even though seeing it on screen is gonna give me tremendous feels ;_;

despite the emotional effects, GRRM is a brilliant author. ASOIAF/GoT is the best thing I’ve read and watched since LOTR :P[/quote]
Agree completely, and the ending of the second season (from what I watched) made me yell that I have to wait another 200+ days! OMG >_>
